commit.message:
configure.in: Always check for sys/types.h

2002-05-30	Marc Espie <espie@openbsd.org>
	* configure.in:  Always check for sys/types.h
	* configure:  Regenerate.

From-SVN: r54071

files.patch:
@@ -1,3 +1,7 @@
+2002-05-30	Marc Espie <espie@openbsd.org>
+	* configure.in:  Always check for sys/types.h
+	* configure:  Regenerate.
+
 2002-05-28  Nick Clifton  <nickc@cambridge.redhat.com>
 
 	* testsuite/lib/libstdc++-v3-dg.exp (libstdc++-v3-init):

@@ -1084,7 +1084,7 @@ ac_configure=$ac_aux_dir/configure # This should be Cygnus configure.
 
     
 
-  for ac_prog in gawk mawk nawk awk
+  for ac_prog in mawk gawk nawk awk
 do
 # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
@@ -8251,7 +8251,7 @@ else
 
   # Check for available headers.
   for ac_hdr in nan.h ieeefp.h endian.h sys/isa_defs.h machine/endian.h \
-  machine/param.h sys/machine.h fp.h locale.h float.h inttypes.h gconv.h
+  machine/param.h sys/machine.h fp.h locale.h float.h inttypes.h gconv.h sys/types.h
 do
 ac_safe=`echo "$ac_hdr" | sed 'y%./+-%__p_%'`
 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_hdr""... $ac_c" 1>&6
@@ -20559,7 +20559,7 @@ else
 fi
 rm -f conftest*
 
-  for ac_hdr in stdlib.h unistd.h sys/stat.h sys/types.h
+  for ac_hdr in unistd.h
 do
 ac_safe=`echo "$ac_hdr" | sed 'y%./+-%__p_%'`
 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_hdr""... $ac_c" 1>&6
@@ -20691,24 +20691,11 @@ else
 #include <fcntl.h>
 #include <sys/mman.h>
 
-#if HAVE_SYS_TYPES_H
-# include <sys/types.h>
-#endif
-
-#if HAVE_STDLIB_H
-# include <stdlib.h>
-#endif
-
-#if HAVE_SYS_STAT_H
-# include <sys/stat.h>
-#endif
-
-#if HAVE_UNISTD_H
-# include <unistd.h>
-#endif
-
 /* This mess was copied from the GNU getpagesize.h.  */
 #ifndef HAVE_GETPAGESIZE
+# ifdef HAVE_UNISTD_H
+#  include <unistd.h>
+# endif
 
 /* Assume that all systems that can run configure have sys/param.h.  */
 # ifndef HAVE_SYS_PARAM_H
@@ -20816,7 +20803,7 @@ main()
 }
 
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:20820: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext} && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null
+if { (eval echo configure:20807: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext} && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null
 then
   ac_cv_func_mmap_fixed_mapped=yes
 else
@@ -20847,17 +20834,17 @@ fi
 do
 ac_safe=`echo "$ac_hdr" | sed 'y%./+-%__p_%'`
 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_hdr""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:20851: checking for $ac_hdr" >&5
+echo "configure:20838: checking for $ac_hdr" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_header_$ac_safe'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 20856 "configure"
+#line 20843 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <$ac_hdr>
 EOF
 ac_try="$ac_cpp conftest.$ac_ext >/dev/null 2>conftest.out"
-{ (eval echo configure:20861: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
+{ (eval echo configure:20848: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
 ac_err=`grep -v '^ *+' conftest.out | grep -v "^conftest.${ac_ext}\$"`
 if test -z "$ac_err"; then
   rm -rf conftest*
@@ -20890,7 +20877,7 @@ done
     # Can't do these in a loop, else the resulting syntax is wrong.
     
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 20894 "configure"
+#line 20881 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <sys/resource.h>
                   #include <unistd.h>
@@ -20899,7 +20886,7 @@ int main() {
  int f = RLIMIT_DATA ; 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:20903: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
+if { (eval echo configure:20890: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   glibcpp_mresult=1
 else
@@ -20916,7 +20903,7 @@ EOF
 
     
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 20920 "configure"
+#line 20907 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <sys/resource.h>
                   #include <unistd.h>
@@ -20925,7 +20912,7 @@ int main() {
  int f = RLIMIT_RSS ; 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:20929: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
+if { (eval echo configure:20916: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   glibcpp_mresult=1
 else
@@ -20942,7 +20929,7 @@ EOF
 
     
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 20946 "configure"
+#line 20933 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <sys/resource.h>
                   #include <unistd.h>
@@ -20951,7 +20938,7 @@ int main() {
  int f = RLIMIT_VMEM ; 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:20955: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
+if { (eval echo configure:20942: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   glibcpp_mresult=1
 else
@@ -20968,7 +20955,7 @@ EOF
 
     
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 20972 "configure"
+#line 20959 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <sys/resource.h>
                   #include <unistd.h>
@@ -20977,7 +20964,7 @@ int main() {
  int f = RLIMIT_AS ; 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:20981: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
+if { (eval echo configure:20968: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   glibcpp_mresult=1
 else
@@ -20999,7 +20986,7 @@ EOF
 else
   
       cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 21003 "configure"
+#line 20990 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <sys/resource.h>
 		      #include <unistd.h>
@@ -21008,7 +20995,7 @@ int main() {
  struct rlimit r; setrlimit(0, &r);
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:21012: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
+if { (eval echo configure:20999: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   ac_setrlimit=yes
 else
@@ -21024,7 +21011,7 @@ fi
   fi
 
   echo $ac_n "checking for testsuite memory limit support""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:21028: checking for testsuite memory limit support" >&5
+echo "configure:21015: checking for testsuite memory limit support" >&5
   if test $setrlimit_have_headers = yes && test $ac_setrlimit = yes; then
     ac_mem_limits=yes
     cat >> confdefs.h <<\EOF
@@ -21040,7 +21027,7 @@ EOF
   # Look for setenv, so that extended locale tests can be performed.
   
   echo $ac_n "checking for setenv declaration""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:21044: checking for setenv declaration" >&5
+echo "configure:21031: checking for setenv declaration" >&5
   if test x${glibcpp_cv_func_setenv_use+set} != xset; then
     if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'glibcpp_cv_func_setenv_use'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
@@ -21055,14 +21042,14 @@ ac_link='${CXX-g++} -o conftest${ac_exeext} $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS $LDFLAGS conftes
 cross_compiling=$ac_cv_prog_cxx_cross
 
       cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 21059 "configure"
+#line 21046 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <stdlib.h>
 int main() {
  setenv(0, 0, 0);
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:21066: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
+if { (eval echo configure:21053: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   glibcpp_cv_func_setenv_use=yes
 else
@@ -21088,12 +21075,12 @@ fi
     for ac_func in setenv
 do
 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_func""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:21092: checking for $ac_func" >&5
+echo "configure:21079: checking for $ac_func" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_$ac_func'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 21097 "configure"
+#line 21084 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* System header to define __stub macros and hopefully few prototypes,
     which can conflict with char $ac_func(); below.  */
@@ -21116,7 +21103,7 @@ $ac_func();
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:21120: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:21107: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_func_$ac_func=yes"
 else
@@ -21171,18 +21158,18 @@ fi
 
 # Check to see if libgcc_s exists, indicating that shared libgcc is possible.
 echo $ac_n "checking for shared libgcc""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:21175: checking for shared libgcc" >&5
+echo "configure:21162: checking for shared libgcc" >&5
 ac_save_CFLAGS="$CFLAGS"
 CFLAGS=' -lgcc_s'
 cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 21179 "configure"
+#line 21166 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 int main() {
 return 0
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:21186: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:21173: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   glibcpp_shared_libgcc=yes
 else
@@ -21216,14 +21203,14 @@ if test $enable_symvers = yes ; then
       echo 'FOO { global: f[a-z]o; local: *; };' > conftest.map
       
       cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 21220 "configure"
+#line 21207 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 int foo;
 int main() {
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:21227: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:21214: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   enable_symvers=gnu
 else
@@ -21265,7 +21252,7 @@ else
   GLIBCPP_BUILD_VERSIONED_SHLIB_FALSE=
 fi
 echo $ac_n "checking versioning on shared library symbols""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:21269: checking versioning on shared library symbols" >&5
+echo "configure:21256: checking versioning on shared library symbols" >&5
 echo "$ac_t""$enable_symvers" 1>&6
 
 
@@ -21355,13 +21342,13 @@ glibcpp_toolexeclibdir=no
 glibcpp_prefixdir=${prefix}
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for interface version number""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:21359: checking for interface version number" >&5
+echo "configure:21346: checking for interface version number" >&5
 libstdcxx_interface=$INTERFACE
 echo "$ac_t""$libstdcxx_interface" 1>&6
 
 # Process the option --with-gxx-include-dir=<path to include-files directory>
 echo $ac_n "checking for --with-gxx-include-dir""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:21365: checking for --with-gxx-include-dir" >&5
+echo "configure:21352: checking for --with-gxx-include-dir" >&5
 # Check whether --with-gxx-include-dir or --without-gxx-include-dir was given.
 if test "${with_gxx_include_dir+set}" = set; then
   withval="$with_gxx_include_dir"
@@ -21385,7 +21372,7 @@ echo "$ac_t""$gxx_include_dir" 1>&6
 
 # Process the option "--enable-version-specific-runtime-libs"
 echo $ac_n "checking for --enable-version-specific-runtime-libs""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:21389: checking for --enable-version-specific-runtime-libs" >&5
+echo "configure:21376: checking for --enable-version-specific-runtime-libs" >&5
 # Check whether --enable-version-specific-runtime-libs or --disable-version-specific-runtime-libs was given.
 if test "${enable_version_specific_runtime_libs+set}" = set; then
   enableval="$enable_version_specific_runtime_libs"
@@ -21434,7 +21421,7 @@ if test x"$glibcpp_toolexecdir" = x"no"; then
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for install location""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:21438: checking for install location" >&5
+echo "configure:21425: checking for install location" >&5
 echo "$ac_t""$gxx_include_dir" 1>&6

@@ -278,7 +278,7 @@ else
 
   # Check for available headers.
   AC_CHECK_HEADERS([nan.h ieeefp.h endian.h sys/isa_defs.h machine/endian.h \
-  machine/param.h sys/machine.h fp.h locale.h float.h inttypes.h gconv.h])
+  machine/param.h sys/machine.h fp.h locale.h float.h inttypes.h gconv.h sys/types.h])
 
   GLIBCPP_CHECK_COMPILER_FEATURES
   GLIBCPP_CHECK_LINKER_FEATURES
